overview: Keith was formerly an Entrepreneur in Residence and Investment Director at REI Capital, where he identified investment opportunities and played an active management role in several portfolio companies. Prior to REI Capital, Keith was formerly the Co-Creator and COO at Prize Capital, LLC an innovative financial model at the intersection of invention, investment and philanthropy - where he remains a Senior Advisor. Keith spun the Prize Capital model into a private company out of the X PRIZE Foundation where he was the EVP of Strategic Development – where he spearheaded an effort to create a modern-day version of the Nobel Prize. To support this vision, he led a successful effort to expand the Board of Trustees, and raised over $20M to support the development of a series of global inducement prizes in a variety of areas including energy, the environment/carbon, genomics, medicine, nanotechnology, transportation, education and social entrepreneurship. He previously started and sold several companies, including a non-traditional media company in 2000, and a Hispanic DRTV- advertising agency in 2003. From 1996-1999, Keith was the Director of Operations at Sun Apparel/The Polo Jeans Company, a $800M global manufacturer, distributor and retailer of casual apparel that was sold to Jones Apparel Group. Civic leadership, youth development and national service has long been a focus for Keith, including a stint at the US Embassy in Mexico City in 1994 and as a volunteer corps member and then later as a national staff member with City Year, an “action tank” for national service. He his active on boards and is an advisor to several start-ups and non-profit organizations. His is also member of the NRDC’s Environmental Entrepreneurs (E2.org). Keith holds a B.A. from Northeastern University, an MBA from the Thunderbird School of Global Management and has attended several executive seminars including Governing for Nonprofit Excellence: Critical Issues for Board Leadership at Harvard Business School. He has lived, worked, studied or traveled to over 30 countries and is fluent in Spanish and proficient in Japanese. He currently lives in Silicon Valley with his wife Michiko and their daughter Harmony
